    Getting Started

    Jake Vestal

    3/12/2021

    fintech-trading-competition.Rmd

    While you’re creating your paper trading account, you’ll encounter instructions from Interactive Brokers (IBKR) regarding how to access your account for trading.

    To get started, it’s recommended you select from one of the three recommended client apps, outlined below:

    0) Register for the Competition

    To register, all you need is to be a current graduate or undergrad student at an accredited university with a .edu email address. Follow the link posted on the main page to sign up. At this time, registration for the Spring 2021 session is closed, but we are extremely excited to welcome students for the next session in the fall!

    1) Trader Workstation (TWS)

    The Trader Workstation is IBKR’s client app that connects to the brokerage and allows you to make trades and view real-time market data, including news & bulletins. TWS is intended to be installed on your computer (Mac, Windows, Unix) and can be customized to your liking following the documentation on IBKR’s home page.

    To install TWS, you’ll want to visit the TWS download page and install the correct version for your system. Log in using your IBKR credentials and start trading!

    2) IBKR Mobile

    Interactive Brokers offers a mobile app from which you can access your account to make trade and view market data. The app is available on Android and iOS.

    3) IB Gateway (IBG)

    IB Gateway is identical to TWS in every way except that there is no graphical user interface (GUI) – you’re expected to connect to a running instance of IBG using one of the various APIs made available by IBKR. To download, visit the IBG download page.

    Traders’ University

    IBKR maintains a set of videos on their Traders’ University site where you can learn about the different financial instruments and how to trade them using your system of choice.

    Developed by Jake Vestal.

    Site built with pkgdown 1.6.1.
